item.title: ã€Thinking Elixir 287: From RAGs to Rich Workflowsã€‘Thinking Elixir 287ï¼šä» RAG åˆ°ä¸°å¯Œçš„å·¥ä½œæµç¨‹
item.description:
ã€

Thinking Elixir 287: From RAGs to Rich Workflows

13 Jan 2026 by brainlid

Episode 287 of Thinking Elixir. News includes Arcana, a new RAG library for Phoenix that adds vector search and AI Q&A using Postgres and pgvector, a JavaScript embedding library called MquickjsEx that brings MicroQuickJS to Elixir processes, LiveDebugger v0.5.0 with support for LiveView Streams, DaisyUI officially supporting Phoenix in their commercial dashboard templates, Durable - a new workflow engine similar to Temporal, JosÃ© Valim teasing beautiful type system improvements, the Hologram project receiving an EEF stipend, Jido 2.0 demonstrating swarms of 1,575 agents indexing code in 7 seconds, ElixirConf EU 2026 announcing JosÃ© Valim and Chris McCord as keynote speakers, and more!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cULPRZTUWZQ

View on ElixirStatus

item.title: ã€Exploring Distributed Elixirã€‘æ¢ç´¢åˆ†å¸ƒå¼ Elixir
item.description:
ã€

Exploring Distributed Elixir

8 Jan 2026 by svenvc

This tutorial explores Distributed Elixir using only the standard library. We set up a cluster with several nodes, call GenServers from one node to another and receive messages from a remote node after subscribing to a pub sub topic or from monitoring a process.

https://blog.stfx.eu/2025-12-29-exploring-distributed-elixer.html

Hologram Awarded Erlang Ecosystem Foundation Stipend for Development Milestones

7 Jan 2026 by bartblast

The Erlang Ecosystem Foundation has awarded a stipend to support key development milestones for Hologram. The funding will help deliver new capabilities while deepening the projectâ€™s integration with the broader BEAM community. More here: https://hologram.page/blog/hologram-awarded-eef-stipend

item.title: ã€Thinking Elixir 286: A NextJS Escape and 2025 in Reviewã€‘Thinking Elixir 286ï¼šNextJS çš„é€ƒäº¡å’Œ 2025 å¹´å›é¡¾
item.description:
ã€

Thinking Elixir 286: A NextJS Escape and 2025 in Review

6 Jan 2026 by brainlid

Episode 286 of Thinking Elixir. News includes a compelling story of transitioning from NextJS to Phoenix and Ash in just two weeks, Credo 1.7.15 with massive performance improvements dropping runtime from 33 to 9 seconds on large codebases, Soothsayer library updates for time series forecasting, Torchx now running on Apple Metal, an EEF case study on how DNSimple uses Erlang to handle hundreds of billions of DNS queries monthly, the first ever GleamLang conference announced for 2026, and more! After the news, we take a retrospective look at 2025, reviewing notable events and trends throughout the year.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OW0RIuyghPM

View on ElixirStatus
ã€‘<è¡¨æ ¼å®½åº¦=â€œ100%â€è¾¹æ¡†=â€œ0â€>

Thinking Elixir ç¬¬ 286 é›†ã€‚æ–°é—»åŒ…æ‹¬åœ¨çŸ­çŸ­ä¸¤å‘¨å†…ä» NextJS è¿‡æ¸¡åˆ° Phoenix å’Œ Ash çš„å¼•äººå…¥èƒœçš„æ•…äº‹ã€Credo 1.7.15 çš„å·¨å¤§æ€§èƒ½æ”¹è¿›ï¼Œå°†å¤§å‹ä»£ç åº“çš„è¿è¡Œæ—¶é—´ä» 33 ç§’é™ä½åˆ° 9 ç§’ã€ç”¨äºæ—¶é—´åºåˆ—é¢„æµ‹çš„ Soothsayer åº“æ›´æ–°ã€Torchx ç°åœ¨åœ¨ Apple Metal ä¸Šè¿è¡Œã€å…³äº DNSimple å¦‚ä½•ä½¿ç”¨ Erlang æ¯æœˆå¤„ç†æ•°åƒäº¿ä¸ª DNS æŸ¥è¯¢çš„ EEF æ¡ˆä¾‹ç ”ç©¶ã€å®£å¸ƒå°†äº 2026 å¹´ä¸¾åŠçš„é¦–å±Š GleamLang ä¼šè®®ç­‰ç­‰ï¼æ–°é—»å‘å¸ƒåï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å›é¡¾ 2025 å¹´ï¼Œå›é¡¾å…¨å¹´çš„é‡å¤§äº‹ä»¶å’Œè¶‹åŠ¿ã€‚

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OW0RIuyghPM

item.title: ã€Guide to Parsing Financial Protocols and the FEBRABAN Standard with Elixir Binariesã€‘ä½¿ç”¨ Elixir äºŒè¿›åˆ¶æ–‡ä»¶è§£æé‡‘èåè®®å’Œ FEBRABAN æ ‡å‡†çš„æŒ‡å—
item.description:
ã€

Guide to Parsing Financial Protocols and the FEBRABAN Standard with Elixir Binaries

3 Jan 2026 by matheuscamarques

Recently, however, I found myself deep in the trenches of the FEBRABAN standardâ€”the backbone of financial data exchange in Brazil. Back then, looking at those massive technical manuals, I didnâ€™t fully grasp the elegance that could be hidden within those rigid lines. I had parsed files before, and while I managed to make them work, I often felt I was fighting against the legacy formats rather than working with them.

https://dev.to/matheuscamarques/the-definitive-guide-to-parsing-financial-protocols-and-the-febraban-standard-5fkj

item.title: ã€Are Feature Flags Bullsh*t? Why Your "IF" is Killing Performance (and the Planet)ã€‘åŠŸèƒ½æ ‡å¿—æ˜¯èƒ¡è¯´å…«é“å—ï¼Ÿä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆä½ çš„â€œå¦‚æœâ€æ­£åœ¨æ‰¼æ€æ€§èƒ½ï¼ˆå’Œåœ°çƒï¼‰
item.description:
ã€

Are Feature Flags Bullsh*t? Why Your "IF" is Killing Performance (and the Planet)

30 Dec 2025 by matheuscamarques

Using Elixirâ€™s metaprogramming (Code.compile_quoted) and the BEAMâ€™s Hot Code Swapping, we can transform a configuration flag into a reactive recompilation. Instead of asking if a flag is active, the system is structurally altered to execute only the necessary code.

https://dev.to/matheuscamarques/are-feature-flags-bullsht-why-your-if-is-killing-performance-and-the-planet-26bi

View on ElixirStatus
ã€‘<è¡¨æ ¼å®½åº¦=â€œ100%â€è¾¹æ¡†=â€œ0â€>

åŠŸèƒ½æ ‡å¿—æ˜¯èƒ¡è¯´å…«é“å—ï¼Ÿä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆä½ çš„â€œå¦‚æœâ€æ­£åœ¨æ‰¼æ€æ€§èƒ½ï¼ˆå’Œåœ°çƒï¼‰

<å­—ä½“é¢œè‰²=â€œ#aaaâ€> <å­—ä½“é¢œè‰²=â€œ#aaaâ€> 2025 å¹´ 12 æœˆ 30 æ—¥ <å­—ä½“é¢œè‰²=â€œ#aaaâ€> é€šè¿‡ æ•°å­¦æ¨¡å‹ <å­—ä½“é¢œè‰²=â€œ#aaaâ€>

ä½¿ç”¨ Elixir çš„å…ƒç¼–ç¨‹ (Code.compile_quoted) å’Œ BEAM çš„çƒ­ä»£ç äº¤æ¢ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥å°†é…ç½®æ ‡å¿—è½¬æ¢ä¸ºååº”å¼é‡æ–°ç¼–è¯‘ã€‚ç³»ç»Ÿåœ¨ç»“æ„ä¸Šè¿›è¡Œäº†æ›´æ”¹ï¼Œåªæ‰§è¡Œå¿…è¦çš„ä»£ç ï¼Œè€Œä¸æ˜¯è¯¢é—®æ ‡å¿—æ˜¯å¦å¤„äºæ´»åŠ¨çŠ¶æ€ã€‚

https://dev.to/matheuscamarques/are-feature-flags-bullsht-why-your-if-is-killing-performance-and-the-planet-26bi

<å°æ—¶> åœ¨ ElixirStatus ä¸ŠæŸ¥çœ‹
